column6: DUPE FOR FENTY BEAUTY BOMB GLOSS
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2017
column14: I'm actually pleasantly surprised with this gloss! I recently got into lip gloss and I fell in love with Rihanna's Bomb Gloss but I'm trying to save my money. I found that the swatch is really similar and I wish I had a photo to compare the two but I really enjoy Revlon's Rosy Future. It is a bit sheer but on my lips it really does compliment my natural lip color, so it's like my lips but better. You do have to reapply more if you want the color to be more opaque, but I really don't mind having to do that since this gloss is only 6 dollars lol what could you expect. Overall I would definitely buy it again!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2019
column14: Does the job. Not too thick. I wear invisalign so I'm sorry for the goofy smiles. I bought the super natural color and it blends right in with my natural lip color

column6: Blissed out and fatal apple - gorgeous and perfect for everyday!!!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
column14: These are just so so perfect! They feel exactly like a liquid lip balm. Not at all overly glossy, reflective, or glass-like, which is why I strayed away from glosses many times. These are just great!!! I love them! They can definitely be used in a professional setting. Don't be afraid about any opaque pigment issues with these shades. They go on very sheer and balmy with a sort of clear, gel-like base. Fatal apple is exactly like a clear red that reads as a sheer, clear red-pink (DUPE FOR GLOSSIER 'RED'). Blissed out is a perfect sheer warm, clear-pink with gorgeous shimmers that is not at all over the top (DUPE FOR FENTY 'FU$$Y'), and it will definitely work on many skin tones because it doesn't have any opaque color. It is like a clear pink gel with tiny shimmers. You can only see the shimmers if you examine your lips up close with a mirror. Otherwise from even a short distance, it just looks like you're wearing a slightly reflective lip balm. So so so good. I 100% plan on repurchasing after I finish. These are my new faves!!!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2018
column14: I bought Rosy Future as an alternative to Fenty Beauty's Gloss Bomb (per a YouTube video!). Much cheaper and I really like it. Looks great when applied over a lip pencil. Just enough color and shine, which is what I wanted. Easy to apply, not sticky, lips are moist. Also bought one for a friend. Got this just before the price went up but would still purchase again.
